results.title: The Prince and the showgirl
results.creator_credit: Jack Harris, Terence Rattigan, Laurence Olivier, L O P Ltd and Marilyn Monroe Productions
results.brief_description: A dazzling American showgirl, (Marilyn Monroe) catches the monacled eye of a debonair prince, (Laurence Olivier). Opposites attract as His Higness Grand Duke Charles succumbs to the unpolished but vivacious Milwaukee chorus girl Elsie Marina, abandoning his “stuffed shirt” posture for her more commonsense approach to life. While the Prince’s state is beset by political worries, he seeks escape in an affair of the heart. Elsie is also interested in affairs, but in the affairs of State. When she pits her “Yankee” ingenuity against the Balkan bigwigs who want to remove Charles, they are no match. Monroe radiates beauty and charm, while Olivier is the perfect counterpart as the straight-man in this romantic comedy.

results.title: Irma La Douce
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, Daniel Mandell, Billy Wilder, Edward Alperson and Mirisch Corporation
results.brief_description: Comedy set in the red-light district of Paris, where Irma La Douce (Shirley MacLaine) is a “working girl”. A naive gendarme (Jack Lemmon) falls for the beautiful Irma after conducting a one-man raid on a notorious backstreet establishment. He becomes Irma’s “business manager” but soon becomes insanely jealous of her clientele and in despair, devises a clever way to keep her all to himself. MacLaine and Lemmon display their impressive comic talents under Billy Wilder’s direction. This screen adaptation was based on the successful Broadway musical.

results.title: Swiss Family Robinson
results.creator_credit: Peter Boita, Ken Annakin, Bill Anderson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
One of Disney’s biggest and most fondly remembered films, chronicles the exploits of the Robinson family after they are shipwrecked on a deserted island. Using teamwork and ingenuity, they skillfully overcome the obstacles of nature but the ultimate challenge lies ahead when a band of pirates threatens their paradise. Stars John Mills, Dorothy McGuire, James MacArthur and Janet Munro.
From the novel “Swiss Family Robinson” by Johann Wyss

results.title: Spartacus
results.creator_credit: Robert Lawrence, Stanley Kubrick, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lawrence, Stanley Kubrick, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas, and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood. Cast also includes Charles Laughton. Based on novel by Howard Fast.

results.title: Colin Thiele
results.creator_credit: David Perry, Peter Campbell, AFI [au] and Australia Council
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Videos on Australian Writers: archival writers series II”.
Author, poet and biographer, Colin Thiele recalls his childhood in the German migrant community north of the Barossa Valley and his early love of literature. Thiele remembers his student days and his association with movements such as the Angry Penguins. He also discusses the effect on his life and work of his long battle with rheumatoid arthritis and reads a poem about the isolation of pain.

results.title: Strictly ballroom
results.creator_credit: Catherine Martin, Jill Bilcock, Baz Luhrmann, Tristram Miall and M and A Productions
results.brief_description: The hit of the Cannes Film Festival of 1992 is a spirited, allegorical musical about a young, competitive ballroom dancer who outrages his mother and the “establishment” by insisting on dancing his own provocative steps and taking on a new ugly-duckling partner who blooms under his tutelage. Ballet dancer Paul Mercurio shot to fame with this film. He is partnered by Tara Morice and supported by Barry Otto, Gia Carides and Bill Hunter.

results.title: I See a dark stranger = The Adventuress
results.creator_credit: Thelma Connell, Frank Launder, Sidney Gilliat and Individual Pictures
results.brief_description: The shadowy world of German espionage in wartime Britain. Bridie Quilty has grown up in the west of Ireland under the influence of her father’s nationalism and becomes an innocent member of a German spy network. When she discovers secret plans for the D-Day landings - and falls in love with an English officer on leave - she faces her moment of truth on the Isle of Man in the climax of this atmospheric thriller. Stars Deborah Kerr, Trevor Howard and Raymond Huntley.

results.title: An American in Paris
results.creator_credit: Adrienne Fazan, Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An American in Paris tells the story of an ex-GI art student who has fallen in love with a young French girl and then sadly has been parted from her. At their separation he reflects on his feelings towards Paris - the frustration’s, joys and miseries that have been part of his life and his falling in love. Gene Kelly teams up with Leslie Caron in this spectacularly staged musical featuring songs by George and Ira Gershwin. Academy Award for Best Film 1951.

results.title: Oklahoma!
results.creator_credit: Orry-Kelly, George Boemler, Fred Zimmerman, Arthur Hornblow, Rodgers and Hammerstein and Magna Corporation
results.brief_description: Set in the Oklahoma Territory in the early 1900s “Oklahoma!” is an idealised vision of a simpler time, a story of tender romance and violent passion. With choreography by Agnes De Mille, the score is ripe with classics: “Oh, What A Beautiful Mornin’”, “The Surrey With The Fringe On Top”, “People Will Say We’re In Love” “Oaklahoma” and many more. This was the first Rodgers and Hammerstein collaboration, starting the most successful creative partnership in the history of musical theatre.

results.title: The More things change
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, Robyn Nevin, Jill Robb, New South Wales Film Corporation and Syme International Productions
results.brief_description: A couple decide to give up living in the city and move to a farm, where the husband takes over the job of looking after their young son whilst his wife continues her city job. To alleviate the tension arising from the change in roles they hire a 19 year old live-in child minder who is also four months pregnant. Stars Judy Morris, Barry Otto and Victoria Longley.
